result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DE's motion requesting property to be returned.
Motion Hearing - 01/09/18
12/22/16 Initial Appearance/Arraignment
11/08/16 Initial Appearance

9:49 am - DA calls cases 16CF65, 16CF66, and 16CM92. Defendant Aaron K. Hall in court with attorney John Charles Bachman.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State received an alternate PSI from Atty Bachman yesterday. Comments by Atty Bachman regarding PSI recommendations.  Comments by DE.  Court questions DE regarding classes in prison and other changes in DE.  Summation by Court. Court imposes:

16CF65, Ct 1 - 9 years prison consisting of 
5 years initial confinement, cc to Ct 2, cs to any other sentence in being
4 years extended supervision
Conditions of extended supervision:
DE must maintain absolute sobriety, pay financial obligations including $200 buy money from PPD to be paid to DOC, Maximum prison wages to be applied to restitution while incarcerated.No contact with individuals involved in this matter, participate in and successfully complete any assessments and evaluations as  recommended

16CF65, Ct 2 - 5 years prison consisting of 
3 years initial confinement, cc to Ct 1, cs to any other sentence in being
2 years extended supervision
Conditions of extended supervision:
DE must maintain absolute sobriety, pay financial obligations including $200 buy money from PPD to be paid to DOC, Maximum prison wages to be applied to restitution while incarcerated. No contact with individuals involved in this matter, participate in and successfully complete any assessments and evaluations as  recommended

DE advised to loss of rights as a convicted felon

Court completes written explanation of determinate sentence
DE eligible for Boot Camp and Substance abuse program after 2 years of initial confinement

4 days sentence credit

Appeal rights given
Sentencing hearing on June 1, 2018 at 10:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on April 4, 2018 at 10:30 am.

2:02 pm - Court calls cases 16CF65, 16CF66 and 16CM92 and DA states appearances.  Defendant Aaron K. Hall in court with attorney John Charles Bachman.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Bachman states that DE wants to withdraw his pleas as he felt he was coerced.  Comments by DA.  DE Hall called and sworn.  Direct by Atty Bachman.  Cross by DA. No argument by Atty Bachman.  Argument by DA.  Summation by Court.  Court denies motion to withdraw as there is no basis to withdraw plea.  To be scheduled for final pre trial.  Adjourn 2:34 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Aaron K. Hall
Current: Stanley Correctional Inst. 100 Corrections Dr., Stanley, WI 54768 United States  (Effective: 12-12-2017)
Prior: Marathon County Jail  500 Forest Street, Wausau, WI 54403

Sentencing hearing on November 29, 2017 at 02:15 pm.
to withdraw

10:00 a.m.  DA calls cases 16CF65, 16CF66 and 16CM92 and states appearances. Defendant Aaron K. Hall appeared with attorney Daniel W Linehan. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PSI report acknowledged by Atty Linehan and motion in the case regarding withdrawal as DE's attorney.  DA comments.  Court orders withdrawal with successor defense attorney to be appointed.   

10:04 adj.
to withdraw
Cover letter from Atty Linehan

10:31 am - DA calls cases 16CF65, 16CF66, and 16CM92 and states appearances.  Defendant Aaron K. Hall in court with attorney Daniel W Linehan.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA states agreement.  Comments by Atty Linehan.  DE enters plea of GUILTY to both counts in 16CF65.  Court questions DE regarding the plea and plea questionnaire.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty to both counts in 16CF65, and orders JOC, and on motion of DA. dismisses but reads in 16CF66 and 16CM92.  Court orders a presentence investigation.  Bond to continue.
Plea hearing on May 2, 2017 at 10:30 am.
Motion hearing on April 27, 2017 at 10:30 am.
1 certified copy returned from PRSO

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.

10:00 am - DA calls cases 16CM92, 16CF65 and 16CF66 and states appearances. Defendant Aaron K. Hall in court with attorney Daniel W Linehan.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to misdemeanor case.  Atty Linehan files waiver of preliminary hearing form.  Court questions DE regarding waiver and accepts.  Information filed on 2 felonys, acknowledged and reading waived.  Move to arraignment.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.  Court lifts warrant and sets bond.  One bond for 3 cases.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
Initial appearance on December 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Cases 16CM92, 16CF65 and 16CF66. Defendant Aaron K. Hall not in court.  Atty James R Lex appears. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Lex is searching for an atty for him.  Court orders warrant of $1000 plus execution fee.  One bond for three cases.
